known for its trendy downtown shopping area and bars. 1 mile South of Royal Oak is
, a place very similar to Royal Oak, known for its large lesbian-gay-bisexual-transgender population. North of Royal Oak is Birmingham, an opulent area known for its upscale boutiques.

I-75/the Chrysler Freeway is located directly east of Royal Oak, and runs north-south. I-696/the Reuther Freeway is located directly south or Royal Oak, and runs east-west. Bordering the left-hand side of Royal Oak is Woodward Avenue, which runs northwest-southeast, and will take you southbound directly into

value: (5-6 hours, $25-$50), with many connections in Chicago. Deeply discounted tickets at short notice are often available at Amtrak's Weekly Specials page

Royal Oak is a very walkable city, the downtown area is a mile long, Main Street and Washington Street are the definite downtown areas to walk around.

value: content=During Wednesdays you can see cruiser motorcycles and on Thursdays you can see sports bikes
content=Recognized as one of the top zoos in the nation, ride the train, walk through arctic ring of wildlife. This is a must see.
content=Lesbian, gay, bisexual & transgender community center.
name=Brew and View at the Magic Bag
directions=Just north of 9 Mile Road, on the Northeast side of Woodward Ave
content=Nice and clean Independent film theater; they also have special midnight movie nights on the weekends.

content=Gay pride festival that takes place along 9 mile in Ferndale. (Now relocated to Hart Plaza in downtown Detroit. Ferndale still has a street festival and shuttle service is provided between the two events.)
content=All-ages pool hall, smoking is allowed.

Royal Oak has 2 Disc Golf courses, it is an inexpensive game to get into; there are liquor stores located directly across from the parks that sell individual discs ranging from $9-$18. Also, the store "In Flight" in the Oak Park/Ferndale area also sells discs and other disc golf accessories. The Throw Shop in Ypsilanti, an hour West on I-94, is the largest disc golf store in the region, well worth the trip as it also features a 28-hole disc golf course.

value: content=18 hole course, it is really just a 9 hole course with tees doubled up.
directions=Detroit between Rochester & Main, North of 12 Mile
name=Antiques at the Royal Oak Farmers Market
content=Come here on Sundays to shop for Antiques and Collectibles, baked goods and coffee are also sold here. There is also a tiny cafeteria in the corner that sells inexpensive breakfast and lunch.
address=21640 John R Rd, Hazel Park
directions=From Ferndale: Head east on 9 Mile Rd, turn right at S Chrysler Dr/I-75 Service Drive, then turn right on to John R Rd
content=The preeminent head shop of the Detroit metropolitan area. Knowledgeable and friendly staff.
directions=Located directly across from Oakland Community College near Lincoln & Main St
hours=M-Th 10 AM to 8 PM, F & Sa 10 AM to 9 PM, Su Noon to 5 PM
content=Obscure fine wines and craft beer, competitive prices. All craft brews are sold as singles with no extra markup on them.
content=Upscale grocer, large craft beer and wine selection.

content=Disc golf gear, locally blown glass pipes and other head shop paraphernalia.
content=Fetish fashion boutique, this is a must see.
content=Thrift store, not as large of a selection as other ones in the area.
content=An indoor market that provides space for local artisans and merchants a place for vending. Handmade goods, food, art, photography, jewelry, and many other vendors are found here.

While a lot of fast food restaurants and chains such as Noodles & Company and Jimmy John's can be found in Royal Oak, as a visitor you shouldn't bother wasting your time eating in those establishments.

value: content=Large delicious submarine sandwiches. Don't waste your time eating Subway or Jimmy John's fare; this is the real deal.
content=Family-owned Mediterranean restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating available. Those inclined can order a hookah and partake in smoking shisha with friends.

content='50s style restaurant, Sliders & Milkshakes, malt shakes, ice-cream. Known more for its pink-vinyl decor than its food. A good place to get a late night bite to eat if you can handle the crowds.
content=Vegetarian restaurant open since 1981, features assorted veggie & vegan friendly cuisine such as Mexican dishes and stir fries.
directions=Head east on E 9 Mile Rd, Turn left at Dequindre Rd.
content=Tasty deep-dish pizza, A local favorite. Also has a bar.

content=A diner chain that covers most of south eastern Michigan and inspires nostalgia in all those who leave the area. Leo's is know for its greek salads, gyros, omelets, and coney dogs (a detroit specialty) .
content=Popular spot serves breakfast and lunch.
content=Described as a "Finer Diner" Lots of vegetarian options. Was featured on the Food Network show "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives".
content=Mexican fast casual restaurant, fresh ingredients make the food here & features a salsa bar.

There is a Starbucks and Bean & Leaf Cafe located in Royal Oak, both of which are on Main Street.

value: content=Free Wi-Fi internet connection, one of few smoker friendly places in Royal Oak.
directions=Right across from Oakland Community College
content=Hookah Bar that attracts a young crowd. Free Wi-Fi.

Royal Oak has a ton of bars such as Mr. B's Pub, Woody's, Duggans, O'Tooles, Rock on 3rd, Goodnite Gracie, Sky Club, Ye Olde Saloon, Norm's Field of Dreams and Luna Lounge.

value: directions=Take 12 Mile Rd west across Woodward, the bar is located after Coolidge on your left side

content=Around 40-50 beers on tap and around 80 bottled beers available. German food, Sandwiches, Burgers, Tex-Mex and a few vegetarian options. Has Pool tables and a jukebox. Live music upstairs Th-Sa. Half off appetizers and certain pints are $2.50 on Mondays.

content=Trendy Fake Irish Pub chain, Happy Hour 4PM-7PM $2 Domestic Drafts, $3 Import Drafts, $3 House Wine, $4 Calls, $5 Martinis. Good place for a cheap pint of Guinness during happy hour, Drink specials on Wednesday night also. Tends to get really busy.
directions=One block south of Woodward and 9 mile road on the east side of Woodward
content=Local dive-bar, smoker-friendly. Notable beer selection. Bikers and Hipsters tend to hang out here.
price=1.25 for 1 game, 5 dollars for 5 games
content=Pool hall in downtown Ferndale near the Woodward Avenue Brewers and the Emory. Named after a seedy massage parlor that used to be in Ferndale.
content=Good drink specials, frequented by hipsters. Features Foosball, Golden Tee, Plasma TVs and a pool table for entertainment.
content=Pool, Golden Tee Golf. Nice bar
content=Upscale wine bar with large selection. 4PM to 6 PM everyday half-off all glasses of wine. 80's Thursdays 9 PM-2AM, half off glass wines, $5 martinis, $3 pints of Bastone beer.

Luckily for beer enthusiasts there are a fair number of brewpubs in this area. Brew pubs are restaurants that brew their own beer. For around 10 dollars you can also buy a "growler" from these establishments which holds a half gallon of beer and is a means to buy take-out beer. Besides being a great deal, growlers make a great souvenir. Also, just a short bus ride away is the Woodward Avenue Brewery in Ferndale, take the Smart 450/460 Direction: Inbound (Runs down South Washington) in Royal Oak to get there.

value: content=Award-Winning Beers & Belgian Fries, kids eat free on Sundays.
content=Happy Hour is on Weekdays 2PM-6PM and Saturday 11AM-6PM with 2 dollar pints of their own beer. Also Monday nights is an You Can Eat Fish Fry $9.99 with $2 pints from 8PM-midnight.
content=Food and microbrews, $5.00 Growler refills on Tuesdays, Happy Hour: 2.75 pints. 3 dollar pints on Wednesdays from 9PM-Close.
content=Brew pub that features A deck and sidewalk seating. 2 dollar pints after 9 pm on Sundays. Half-off food on Mondays 4PM-Midnight.

Royal Oak is generally considered a safe city with a low crime rate. Crime is

uncommon during the daytime but spikes considerably during the night time. 

While most crime in Royal Oak affects residents, there have been many cases where travelers were victimized, especially in the case of burglaries of vehicles with out-of-state plates.

While Royal Oak's downtown area is a very safe place, avoid walking into alleyways during the night time. Many strongarm robberies and rape attempts take place in the city's downtown alleyways. The sidewalks and streets of Downtown Royal Oak are otherwise safe to walk during the daytime and night.

Avoid walking in any neighborhoods near or around an industrial park, railroad or apartment complex at night. Drug dealers are often present in these types of neighborhood after dark. If you choose to walk through such neighborhoods after dark remember to wear neutral-colored clothing and avoid large groups of people.

In addition, try not to walk on the Eleven Mile corridor during the night-time outside of the Downtown area as it is where many robberies in the city take place.

Always park in a well-lit area during the night time. Lock your doors and roll up your windows. Even during the day time, car burglaries are common, especially when an open window is involved.

Take further precaution regarding your vehicle if you are the owner of a Chrysler vehicle. Chrysler and Dodge automobiles are often targeted for navigation systems and owners of such vehicles may fall victim much easier.

Royal Oak has a significant homeless population in the city, mostly centered around the downtown area and industrial neighborhoods. If you are approached by a panhandler simply state in a firm tone of voice that you do not wish to pay them and walk away.
